steps.title: Recall the meaning of Easter with a thoughtful religious greeting.
steps.content: Recall the meaning of Easter with a thoughtful religious greeting. Easter isn’t just about hunting for eggs, eating yummy chocolate, and welcoming spring. It’s also a time to remember God’s love and celebrate the resurrection of Christ. Send a loved one a kind blessing or an Easter Bible verse to share joy and faith on this holiday. steps.title: What is a typical Easter greeting?
steps.content: What is a typical Easter greeting? A common Easter greeting is “Happy Easter!” Many will also say “He is risen,” referring to the resurrection of Jesus Christ which Christians celebrate on Easter Sunday. During Easter church service, the pastor may say, “He is risen,” to which the congregation replies, “He is risen indeed.” [6] X Research source

steps.title: How do you wish someone a happy Easter?
steps.content: How do you wish someone a happy Easter? There are many ways to wish someone a happy Easter. Send them a simple greeting with warm wishes for them and their loved ones on the holiday. Or, get them laughing with a punny Easter joke. Another option is to share a Bible verse about the resurrection of Christ, such as Luke 24:6-7: "He is not here; he has risen!"

steps.title: How do you celebrate Easter?
steps.content: How do you celebrate Easter? In the United States, many people celebrate Easter by attending a church service. Many families also decorate Easter eggs, participate in church or community Easter egg hunts for children, and have a special Easter dinner, often featuring ham. In other parts of the world, people celebrate Easter with feasts, making Easter trees, and cooking Easter breakfast. [7] X Research source
